title: unesco_heritage_Historic_Mosque_City_of_Bagerhat
text:
Name: Historic Mosque City of Bagerhat. short_description:

Situated in the suburbs of Bagerhat, at the meeting-point of the Ganges and Brahmaputra rivers, this ancient city, formerly known as Khalifatabad, was founded by the Turkish general Ulugh Khan Jahan in the 15th century. The cityâ€™s infrastructure reveals considerable technical skill and an exceptional number of mosques and early Islamic monuments, many built of brick, can be seen there.
